original: BJÖRKLUND, Gunnar Ruben, Rektor, Hälsingborg, f Uppsala 15/8 82 av brygg.äg Petter B o Maria Pettersson, gm Hille Lundberg. Studex Upps 02, Schartaus hdlsinst 02—03, fil kand 06, fil lic 09, provar v N Latin, Sthlm, 09—10. E.o. där 10—14, utn adj v Halmstad lärov 13, avsk 16, tills m univ.lekt S Charle-stqn led. f sv feriekurser i Oxford 12—14, rekt v Örebro hdlsgymn 14—18, rekt v Hbgs hdlsgymn 18. Stdfm 30—38, v. ordf i badh.styr 30—35 o sed. 38, ordf i stadsrev 35—38, lok. styr.led i h a lärov f goss sed. 37, av skol-överstyr uts sakk f särsk uppdr 29, tf und.v.-råd 19, 24, 25, 28, 30, 37 mm. Led av Skån gymn.förb 26—36, ordf i Hbgs d:o 26—36, led av AB Malmö Saltsjöbads styr mm. Resor: Belg* 29, 35, Engl 00, 07, 12, 13, 14, 24, 32, Finl (segelf) 05, Finl, Ryssl (segelf) 11, Frankr 00, 22, 29, Holl (cklf) 25, 29, Ital 29, Österr 21, 26. Av trycket: Eng läsebok 15, Sv aff.-språk 24, Tysk läseb 24, Eng texter 25, 30, Sv-eng ordb f aff.bruk 33, Eng hdlskorr 39, Eng grammat 42, Tyska texter 42, översättn.-övn f hdlskorr 26, 27, 32, 34, 36. RNO, RVO, OffFrd’A, idr.m, simmarm o skyt.m g, SvGIdrRf förtj.t, Sv gymn.förb med g o distr.-förtj.t g mm, medl av Nya sällsk i Hbg. Hobbies: Gymn o friluftsliv. °BJÖRKLUND, Gustav Erik (Gösta), Civilingenjör, Midsommarkransen, f Sthlm 27/2 98 av övermaskinist K G B o Sofia Vadelius, gm Eva Wallenius. Studex NReal Sthlm 17, KTH (maskinbyggn o mek tekn) 18—22. Assist i läran om förbränningsmotorer o mek värmeteori v KTH 24—25, l:e assist å förbränningsmotor- o kyltekn lab 25—26, anst v Sv AB Gasaccumulator i Sthlm 26—36, vkst dir f AB Dentatus, Midsommarkransen, sed. 36.
translated:
BJÖRKLUND, Gunnar Ruben, Principal, Hälsingborg, born in Uppsala on August 15, 1882, son of brewer owner Petter B and Maria Pettersson, married to Hille Lundberg. Graduate of Uppsala University in 1902, studied at Schartau's Trade Institute in 1902-1903, received Bachelor of Arts in 1906 and licentiate degree in 1909, pursued further studies in Latin in Stockholm from 1909 to 1910. Acting teacher there from 1910 to 1914, appointed as adjunct at Halmstad Grammar School in 1913 and retired in 1916, served as temporary university lecturer at Charlesstaden, Stockholm. Led Swedish summer courses in Oxford from 1912 to 1914, appointed principal at the Örebro Commerce Gymnasium from 1914 to 1918, and later at the Helsingborg Commerce Gymnasium from 1918. Member of the board of directors from 1930 to 1938, vice president of the bathing establishment board from 1930 to 1935 and thereafter, chairman of the city's audit committee from 1935 to 1938, local board member of the higher boys' educational institution since 1937, appointed by the school supervisory board for special duties in 1929, acting advisory council for education in 1919, 1924, 1925, 1928, 1930, and 1937, among others. Member of the Skåne Gymnastics Association from 1926 to 1936, chairman of the Helsingborg Gymnastics Association from 1926 to 1936, member of AB Malmö Saltsjöbad's board, etc. Travelled to Belgium in 1929 and 1935, England in 1900, 1907, 1912, 1913, 1914, 1924, and 1932, Finland (by sailboat) in 1905, Finland and Russia (by sailboat) in 1911, France in 1900, 1922, and 1929, Netherlands (cycling) in 1925 and 1929, Italy in 1929, Austria in 1921 and 1926. Published works include "English Reader" in 1915, "Swedish Business Language" in 1924, "German Reader" in 1924, "English Texts" in 1925 and 1930, "Swedish-English Dictionary for Business Use" in 1933, "English Commercial Correspondence" in 1939, "English Grammar" in 1942, "German Texts" in 1942, and translation exercises for commercial correspondence in 1926, 1927, 1932, 1934, and 1936. Awarded Royal Order of the North Star, Royal Order of Vasa, Officer of the French Legion of Honor, sports and marksmanship merit badges, Swedish Gymnastics Association's deserving badge with gold and district merit badge with gold, and member of the New Society in Helsingborg. Hobbies include gymnastics and outdoor activities.

BJÖRKLUND, Gustav Erik (Gösta), Engineer, Midsommarkransen, born in Stockholm on February 27, 1898, son of chief engineer K G B and Sofia Vadelius, married to Eva Wallenius. Graduate of NReal Stockholm in 1917, studied mechanical engineering at KTH (Royal Institute of Technology) from 1918 to 1922. Assistant in the study of internal combustion engines and heat engineering theory at KTH from 1924 to 1925, first assistant in the internal combustion engine and refrigeration technology laboratory from 1925 to 1926, employed by Swedish AB Gasaccumulator in Stockholm from 1926 to 1936, director of development at AB Dentatus, Midsommarkransen, since 1936.

structured.name: Gunnar Ruben Björklund
honors: Royal Order of the North Star
Officer of the French Legion of Honor
Swedish Gymnastics Association's Deserving Badge with Gold

career.occupational_title: Member of the Board of Directors
